data.text: "Peter Middleton visited Canada when he was 17 years old, arriving with a group of fellow students for a “School Empire Tour Party” in August 1939. Peter is found on a passenger list arriving in Quebec from Liverpool on August 11, 1939, on the SS Andania.
@RoyaleVision The Duchess of Cambridge's grandfather
@princesspleats ❤️ thanks
The incredibly risky tactic https://t.co/SDcPP8puHw
@RoyaleVision Why did the law firm close?  Financial reasons? 👵
@Huriye I believe M. Middleton knows all these, and more 😉
@RoyaleVision Great research! You should send to KP, I'm sure they would love to see and send on to Mr Middleton.

Unsung Hero ! - In August 1944, Peter Middleton flew a de Havilland Mosquito fighter bomber, nudging the wings of deadly German the buzz bombs, or doodlebugs, V-1 flying bombs to divert them from hitting London.
@RoyaleVision James looks a lot like him!!
The South American temporary visa that was issued to Peter Middleton ahead of his tour with Prince Philip, The Duke of Edinburgh https://t.co/6W6JoDgyfj

According to historical records, Peter Middleton first visited Canada when he was 17.  Arriving in Halifax (from Liverpool) on August 11, 1939 on the SS Andania, he was part of something called the “School Empire Tour Party”.

Ancestry Canada records show - Captain Peter Middleton was a flying instructor with the Royal Air Force at #37 Service Flying Training School, now occupied by Calgary International airport. during the Second World War. https://t.co/sPri3pC4zc
@RoyaleVision I love her Grandma Valerie's smile 😊 Catherine really comes from a remarkable family!

Prince Philip piloted 49 of the tour’s 62 flights, often with Peter Middleton, who had been specially chosen for the tour by BEA, by his side. Middleton was later sent a letter of thanks and a pair of gold cufflincs from Buckingham Palace. https://t.co/Ozl1wur7fW

The Duchess of Cambridge grandfather Peter Middleton’s first close encounter with the Royal Family was when he acted as First Officer to the Duke of Edinburgh on a two-month flying tour of South America that Prince Philip made in 1962. https://t.co/UMNw6WOXyo
@RoyaleVision @bletchleypark You’re very welcome! Not a great pic, I know, but I was at the end of the tour AND in an extremely hot weather 😅
@Irishsara1980 @bletchleypark ❤️ Thanks for sharing !

@RoyaleVision I have been to @bletchleypark last July, I was so impressed by the work that had to be done there. Those people really saved our future! I also looked for The Duchess’ grandma and her twin sister on the record database :) https://t.co/mhn75KoFQo
@princesspleats @RoyaleVision Oh my! That’s a lot of “great” 😮

The Duchess of Cambridge's grandmother, Valerie Middleton (née Glassborow) (1924 - 2006), worked at the Second World War Government Code and Cypher School (GC&CS) in Bletchley Park https://t.co/YbmYb3S40T
